attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The House of Commons has 646 Members representing us, soon to rise to 650, this is a gross over-representation, with the House of Representatives in the US having 435 Members representing a far bigger electorate.

The Commons should therefore be reduced to a more appropriate size to save the taxpayer millions of pounds for representation that they neither want or need.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament or the Electoral Commission
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
